title: Samsung Galaxy Tab
content:
{{Short description|Tablet computer series by Samsung}} {{About|the Galaxy Tab series|the original model known as the Samsung Galaxy Tab|Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0}} {{Redirect|Samsung tablets|the Google branded tablet made by Samsung|Nexus 10}} {{Infobox information appliance | name = Samsung Galaxy Tab | logo = Samsung Galaxy Tab new logo.svg | logo_size = 200px | image = 20230729 삼성 갤럭시 탭 S9.jpg | caption = Front of the [[Samsung Galaxy Tab S9]] | manufacturer = [[Samsung Electronics]] | release date = {{Start date and age|df=yes|2010|11|05}} | type = [[Tablet computer|Tablet Computers]] | os = [[Android (operating system)|Android]]
[[One UI]] | input = [[Touch screen]]
[[S Pen]] | related = [[Samsung Galaxy Fold]]
[[Samsung Galaxy Note]]
[[Samsung Galaxy Tab S8]]
[[Samsung Galaxy Tab A8]] | website = https://www.samsung.com/us/tablets/ | family = *[[Galaxy Tab S (disambiguation)|Galaxy Tab S]] (flagship)
*[[Galaxy Tab A]] (mid-range) | soc = [[Exynos]] (from 2010–2019)
[[Nvidia Tegra]] (from 2011–2012)
[[Intel]] (from 2013–2016)
[[Qualcomm Snapdragon|Snapdragon]] (from 2012–now)
[[MediaTek]] (from 2021–now)
[[Unisoc]] (from 2021–now) }} [[File:Galaxy_Tab_logo.svg|200px|thumb|The Samsung Galaxy Tab logo until 2015]] The '''Samsung Galaxy Tab''' is a line of [[Android (operating system)|Android OS]] [[tablet computers]] produced by [[Samsung Electronics]]. The first model was the [[Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0|Samsung Galaxy Tab 2010]] with 7-inch display, which was presented to the public on 2 September 2010 at the [[Internationale Funkausstellung Berlin|IFA]] in [[Berlin]] and was available on 5 November 2010.{{cite web |url=https://www.pcmag.com/article2/0,2817,2368214,00.asp |title=Samsung Galaxy Tablet Coming in September |author=Tim Gideon |date=24 August 2010 |work=[[PC Magazine]] |access-date=4 Dec 2010}} Since then several models have been released, including models with 7.7, 8.9 and 10.1-inch displays. The [[Wi-Fi]] versions of the tablet include a [[GPS]] system, and the 3G/4G/5G tablets add cellular capability. {{As of|2023}}, the current products are the '''Galaxy Tab S''' at flagship level and '''Galaxy Tab A''' in the mid-range. The flagship tablets support the [[S Pen]] digital stylus and use the [[Qualcomm Snapdragon|Snapdragon]] 8 series chipset. {{TOC limit|3}} == Models == === Samsung Galaxy Tab === {{timeline of release years | range1 = 2010-2014 | range1_color = #FFFF00 | 2010a = Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 | 2010b = Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus | 2011a = Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.7 | 2011b = Samsung Galaxy Tab 8.9 | 2011c = Samsung Galaxy Tab 10.1 | 2012a = Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 7.0 | 2012b = Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 10.1 | 2013a = Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 7.0 | 2013b = Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 8.0 | 2013c = Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 10.1 | 2014a = Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 Lite 7.0 | 2014b = Samsung Galaxy Tab 4 7.0 | 2014c = Samsung Galaxy Tab 4 8.0 | 2014d = Samsung Galaxy Tab 4 10.1 }} The original Samsung Galaxy Tab series was the original line of Samsung tablets. It was later split into three separate lines: the Galaxy Tab S series for high-end tablets, the Galaxy Tab A series for mid-range tablets, and the Galaxy Tab E series for entry-level tablets. ==== 2010–2011 ==== * [[Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0]] * [[Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus]] * [[Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.7]] * [[Samsung Galaxy Tab 8.9]] * [[Samsung Galaxy Tab 10.1]] ==== 2012 ==== * [[Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 7.0]] * [[Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 10.1]] ==== 2013 ==== * [[Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 7.0]] * [[Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 8.0]] * [[Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 10.1]] ==== 2014 ==== * [[Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 Lite 7.0]] * [[Samsung Galaxy Tab 4 7.0]] * [[Samsung Galaxy Tab 4 8.0]] * [[Samsung Galaxy Tab 4 10.1]] * [[Samsung Galaxy Tab 4 Education]] === Samsung Galaxy Tab Pro === {{timeline of release years | range1 = 2014-2016 | range1_color = #FFFF00 | 2014a = Samsung Galaxy Tab Pro 8.4 | 2014b = Samsung Galaxy Tab Pro 10.1 | 2014c = Samsung Galaxy Tab Pro 12.2 | 2016 = Samsung Galaxy Tab Pro S }} The original Samsung Galaxy Tab Pro devices, released in 2014, were a series of three high-end tablets running the [[Android (operating system)|Android operating system]]. These tablets would be succeeded by the Galaxy Tab S series. In 2016, Samsung released another device in the Tab Pro line, the Samsung Galaxy TabPro S, although that tablet ran [[Windows 10]] instead of Android. It was succeeded by the [[Samsung Galaxy Book]] the following year. ==== 2014 ==== * [[Samsung Galaxy Tab Pro 8.4]] * [[Samsung Galaxy Tab Pro 10.1]] * [[Samsung Galaxy Tab Pro 12.2]] ==== 2016 ==== * [[Samsung Galaxy TabPro S]] === Samsung Galaxy Tab S === {{timeline of release years | range1 = 2014 | range1_color = #FFFA69 | 2014 = Samsung Galaxy Tab S | 2015 = Samsung Galaxy Tab S2 | 2017 = Samsung Galaxy Tab S3 | 2018 = Samsung Galaxy Tab S4 | 2019a = Samsung Galaxy Tab S5e | 2019b = Samsung Galaxy Tab S6 | 2020a = Samsung Galaxy Tab S6 Lite | 2020c = Samsung Galaxy Tab S7+ | 2020b = Samsung Galaxy Tab S7 | 2021 = Samsung Galaxy Tab S7 Fan Edition | 2022a = Samsung Galaxy Tab S8 | 2022b = Samsung Galaxy Tab S8+ | 2022c = Samsung Galaxy Tab S8 Ultra | 2022d = Samsung Galaxy Tab S6 Lite 2022 | 2023a = Samsung Galaxy Tab S9 | 2023b = Samsung Galaxy Tab S9+ | 2023c = Samsung Galaxy Tab S9 Ultra | 2023d = Samsung Galaxy Tab S9 Fan Edition}} The Galaxy Tab S series is Samsung's flagship tablet line, running the [[Android (operating system)|Android]] operating system and mirroring the [[Samsung Galaxy S series|Galaxy S series]] of smartphones. ====2014==== * [[Samsung Galaxy Tab S 8.4]] * [[Samsung Galaxy Tab S 10.5]] ====2015==== * [[Samsung Galaxy Tab S2 8.0]] * [[Samsung Galaxy Tab S2 9.7]] ====2017==== * [[Samsung Galaxy Tab S3]] ====2018==== * [[Samsung Galaxy Tab A series is a mid-range tablet line, mirroring the [[Samsung Galaxy A series|Galaxy A series]] of smartphones. ====2015==== * [[Samsung Galaxy Tab A 8.0]] * [[Samsung Galaxy Tab A 9.7]] ====2016==== * = Samsung Galaxy Tab E 9.6 | 2016 = Samsung Galaxy Tab E 8.0 }} The Samsung Galaxy Tab E series is a line of entry-level tablets. ====2014==== * Samsung Galaxy Tab E 7.0 * Samsung Galaxy Tab E 8.4 * Samsung Galaxy Tab E 10.5 ====2015==== * [[Samsung Galaxy Tab E 9.6]] (T560, T561) ==== 2016 ==== * Samsung Galaxy Tab E 8.0 (T375, T377){{Cite web|title=Samsung Galaxy Tab E 8.0|url=https://www.gsmarena.com/samsung_galaxy_tab_e_8_0-7879.php|access-date=2021-06-17|website=GSMArena}} === Samsung Galaxy Tab Active === {{timeline of release years | range1 = 2014 | range1_color = #3498DB | 2014a = Samsung Galaxy Tab Active | 2014b = Samsung Galaxy Tab Active LTE | 2017 = Samsung Galaxy Tab Active 2 | 2019 = Samsung Galaxy Tab Active Pro | 2020 = Samsung Galaxy Tab Active3 | 2022 = Samsung Galaxy Tab Active4 Pro }} The Samsung Galaxy Tab Active series is a line of rugged tablets designed for outdoor use. Applications include logistics, construction, and [[first responders|first response]]. ====2014==== * Samsung Galaxy Tab Active{{Cite web|title=Samsung Galaxy Tab Active|url=https://www.gsmarena.com/samsung_galaxy_tab_active-6659.php|access-date=2023-11-06|website=GSMArena}} * Samsung Galaxy Tab Active LTE{{Cite web|title=Samsung Galaxy Tab Active LTE|url= https://www.gsmarena.com/samsung_galaxy_tab_active_lte-6658.php|access-date=2023-11-06|website=GSMArena}} ====2017==== * Samsung Galaxy Tab Active 2{{Cite web|title=Samsung Galaxy Tab Active 2|url=https://www.gsmarena.com/samsung_galaxy_tab_active_2-8897.php|access-date=2023-11-06|website=GSMArena}} ==== 2019 ==== * Samsung Galaxy Tab Active Pro{{Cite web|title=Samsung Galaxy Tab Active Pro|url=https://www.gsmarena.com/samsung_galaxy_tab_active_pro-9850.php|access-date=2023-11-06|website=GSMArena}} ====2020==== * Samsung Galaxy Tab Active3{{Cite web|title=Samsung Galaxy Tab Active3|url=https://www.gsmarena.com/samsung_galaxy_tab_active3-10476.php|access-date=2023-11-06|website=GSMArena}} ====2022==== * Samsung Galaxy Tab Active4 Pro{{Cite web|title=Samsung Galaxy Tab Active4 Pro|url=https://www.gsmarena.com/samsung_galaxy_tab_active4_pro-11840.php|access-date=2023-11-06|website=GSMArena}} === Samsung Galaxy Tab Note === {{timeline of release years | range1 = 2012 | range1_color = #0b6623 | 2012 = Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 | 2013a = Samsung Galaxy Note 8.0 | 2013b = Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Edition | 2014 = Samsung Galaxy Note Pro 12.2}} Samsung Galaxy Tab Note series is a line of stylus tablets. ====2012==== * [[Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1]] ====2013==== * [[Samsung Galaxy Note 8.0]] * [[Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Edition]] ====2014==== * [[Samsung Galaxy Note Pro 12.2]] ==Model comparison== === Galaxy Tab S === {| class="wikitable sortable mw-collapsible mw-collapsed" !
